org.jtrim.image.transform

Class ImageTransformerLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncDataLink<TransformedImageData>
    Deprecated. 
    This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines an AsyncDataLink which transforms an image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

    Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

    This class works similar to the AsyncDataLink instances created by the AsyncLinks.convertGradually method. The only difference is that ImageTransformerLink will convert the result of the transformation (TransformedImage) to TransformedImageData.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    @Deprecated
public final class ImageTransformerLink
extends java.lang.Object
implements AsyncDataLink<TransformedImageData>
    See Also:
    AsyncImageDisplay, ImageTransformerQuery

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageTransformerLink

        public ImageTransformerLink(ImageTransformerData input,
                    TaskExecutorService executor,
                    ImageTransformer... imageTransformers)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ImageTransformerLink which will execute the image transformations on the specified TaskExecutorService.
        Parameters:
        input - the input to be transformed by ImageTransformerLink. This argument can be null if the image transformers accept null values.
        executor - the TaskExecutorService on which the image transformers are called. Each image transformation is called in a separate task submitted to this executor. This argument cannot be null.
        imageTransformers - the transformations to be applied to the input image. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This array must contain at least a single element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - throw if the specified executor or the image transformation array or any of its transformation is null

      • ImageTransformerLink

        public ImageTransformerLink(ImageTransformerData input,
                    java.util.List<AsyncDataConverter<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImage>> imageTransformers)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ImageTransformerLink applying the specified image transformations on the input image. The transformations are executed on the associated TaskExecutorService.
        Parameters:
        input - the input to be transformed by ImageTransformerLink. This argument can be null if the image transformers accept null values.
        imageTransformers - the transformations (with their associated TaskExecutorService) to be applied to the input image. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This list must contain at least a single element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified image transformation list is null or contains null elements

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public AsyncDataController getData(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                          AsyncDataListener<? super TransformedImageData> dataListener)
        Deprecated. 
        Starts retrieving the data which is linked to this AsyncDataLink. The data will be forwarded to the specified listener usually asynchronously on a separate thread. Note however that this method may also forward the data synchronously on the current thread to the listener if it is readily available and does not need some expensive operation to load.

        Once this method has been called successfully, the onDoneReceive method of the listener must be called eventually regardless what happens. Failing to call this method is a serious failure of the AsyncDataLink implementation.

        Specified by:
        getData in interface AsyncDataLink<TransformedImageData>
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken signaling if the data retrieval process need to be canceled. Implementations may ignore cancellation requests but they should cancel the data retrieval and call the onDoneReceive method of the listener, signaling that the data retrieval cannot be completed due to cancellation. This argument cannot be null.
        dataListener - the listener to which the data is to be forwarded. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the AsyncDataController which can be used to control the way it is being loaded and request the progress of the data retrieving process. This method must never return null.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the string representation of this AsyncDataLink in no particular format

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.
